newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen higher after CPI.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen higher after CPI.

text.p: U.S. stocks were seen opening higher on Thursday following a report on July inflation at the retail level that matched expectations, analysts said.
"It's basically painless to the economy....the stock market should be firm at the opening at this point," Roy Blumberg, Chief Investment Strategist at Josephthal Lyon and Ross said.

U.S. consumer prices edged up 0.2 percent in July after rising 0.1 percent in June. The so-called "core" rate of inflation, which leaves out the often erratic food and energy measures, also rose 0.2 percent.
